00305 // These are ugly, but necessary utility functions we must use to generate a
00306 // unique identifier inside of the PARAM() module.
00307 #define JOIN(x, y) JOIN_AGAIN(x, y)
00308 #define JOIN_AGAIN(x, y) x ## y
00309 
00325 #ifdef __COUNTER__
00326   #define PARAM(T, ID, DESC, ALIAS, DEF, REQ) static mlpack::io::Option<T> \
00327       JOIN(io_option_dummy_object_, __COUNTER__) \
00328       (false, DEF, ID, DESC, ALIAS, REQ);
00329 
00331   #define PARAM_FLAG_INTERNAL(ID, DESC, ALIAS) static mlpack::io::Option<bool>\
00332   JOIN(__io_option_flag_object_, __COUNTER__) (ID, DESC, ALIAS);
00333 
00335 #else
00336   // We have to do some really bizarre stuff since __COUNTER__ isn't defined.  I
00337   // don't think we can absolutely guarantee success, but it should be "good
00338   // enough".  We use the __LINE__ macro and the type of the parameter to try
00339   // and get a good guess at something unique.
00340   #define PARAM(T, ID, DESC, ALIAS, DEF, REQ) static mlpack::io::Option<T> \
00341       JOIN(JOIN(io_option_dummy_object_, __LINE__), opt) (false, DEF, ID, \
00342       DESC, ALIAS, REQ);
00343 
00345   #define PARAM_FLAG_INTERNAL(ID, DESC, ALIAS) static mlpack::io::Option<bool>\
00346       JOIN(__io_option_flag_object_, __LINE__) (ID, DESC, ALIAS);
00347 
00349 #endif
